title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.39 | 25-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chakshurunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Srimate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvijesha Jhunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda
Shri Advaita Galadhara Srivasa Ali Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Jai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jayam Muthirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 39th verse of the 15th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Mathurayam Tatha Vajram Shura Sena Patim Tathaha Prajapatyam Nirupyeshtim Agneen Apibad Ishwaraha
The meaning of this 39th verse is
Then he posted Vajra, the son of Aniruddha
Aniruddha was the grandson of Lord Krishna
At Mathura
That means
Vajra who was the great grandson of Krishna
Was posted by Yudhishthira at Mathura
As the king of Shura Sena
Afterwards Maharaj Yudhishthira performed a Prajapatiya sacrifice
And placed in himself the fire for quitting household life
He prepared himself to quit household life
After responsibly handing over charge
To Parvatiya
And one person who we have mentioned
And who has mentioned
Everything is related to the
prajapatiya
Var night
They affect people
Situating themselves

It is meant to be

That before the
He had aalla
It will be
life and for quitting household life he has to actually become detached quitting
does not mean go away from home and carry within the heart all the
attachment for household life no that is not the way to quit so Srila Prabhupada
explained this phrase placed in himself the fire for quitting household life
Prabhupada explains in the purport Maharaja Yudhishthira after placing Maharaja
Pariksit on the imperial throne of Hastinapura and after posting Vajra the
great grandson of Lord Krishna as king of Mathura accepted the renounced order
of life so one must quit household life and become detached renounced from all
household life
attachments from all family attachments from all material attachments saw Srila
Prabhupada explains the system of four orders of life and four castes in terms
of quality and work known as varna shrama Dharma is the beginning of real
human life Varana ashrama for Varanas according to occupational characteristics
occupational duties
Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaishya, Shudra, all are qualified differently according to the acquired nature.
Sattvic people, Rajasic people, mixed Rajoguna and Tamoguna and Tamsic people.
So they should work to maintain themselves for the sake of fixing the ultimate goal of life as self-realization.
Not only for Brahmanas, not only for some people, it's for even the Shudras.
It's for every human being within the Varnashrama system.
Every human being.
Every human being.
Every human being.
Four Varnas.
And then four Ashramas.
What are the four Ashramas?
Brahmacharya, Grihastha, Vanaprastha, Sannyas.
These four Ashramas are for gradual spiritual elevation.
So, now Yudhishthira Maharaj is quitting household life
in order to enter the
the stage where one completely dedicates his life for preparing for going back to Godhead.
With no other responsibilities, no other duties.
Because all those responsibilities and duties have been handed over to the son or the grandson
or somebody else younger.
So, human life, real human life means Varnashrama dharma.
This is explained in the scriptures.
Maharaj Yudhishthira, as the protector of this system of human activities,
timely retired from active life as a sanyasi,
handing over the charge of the administration to a trained prince Maharaj Pariksit.
Maharaj Pariksit.
Maharaj Pariksit.
Maharaj Pariksit.
Maharaj Pariksit.
He became detached and renounced after handing over charge.
So, Srila Prabhupada says further,
The scientific system of Varnashrama dharma
divides the human life into four divisions of occupation and four orders of life.
So, Srila Prabhupada elaborates what I just explained.
The four orders of life as Brahmachari, Grhastha, Vanaprastha and Sanyasi
are to be followed by all.
Irrespective of the occupational division.
If somebody is serious about going back home, back to Godhead,
they should follow these divisions that are made in the ashrama system.
Brahmachari means student life.
And Grhastha means householder life.
And Vanaprastha means retired life.
And Sanyasa means renounced.
Or detached life.
So, these stages are natural and very scientific and progressive
for somebody whose ultimate aim of life is to go back to Godhead at the end of this life.
Before quitting the body, one has to prepare.
Now, this goal is for every human being.
Because human being has developed.
Developed intelligence, developed consciousness, developed understanding, developed brain.
That is the meaning of human life.
Now, relatively speaking, one may be more intelligent than the other
in terms of some material calculation.
But as far as spiritual development is concerned,
spiritual advancement is concerned,
all are eligible.
All are...
meant for spiritual elevation.
Of course, this has to be practiced under the proper direction of the bona fide spiritual master.
Spiritual master.
You require spiritual guidance.
Not of any ordinary person.
But one who is actually qualified.
A bona fide spiritual master.
Acharya.
Therefore, you can see in our culture, in our tradition,
there have been acharyas who have preached to the mass of people without discrimination.
Madhvacharya, Ramanujacharya, Shankaracharya, and acharyas.
So, Prabhupada is the acharya for our times.
And he travelled all over the world and preached to everyone.
Everyone.
All sections of people in the society.
Prabhupada was preaching to everyone.
Tirelessly.
He travelled.
He wrote books.
And he instructed his disciples who were dedicated for this preaching mission
in assisting Srila Prabhupada to preach to everyone in the world.
He was instructing them to translate these books into
all the possible languages of the different parts of the world.
Because somebody may not be educated in English.
So then, they can read their local language.
So Prabhupada said, translate his books
into the local language and distribute those books in those languages.
So, Prabhupada's teachings, Prabhupada's instructions, Prabhupada's explanations
are available in all the major languages of the world today.
So, people can read that and learn from the devotees
how to practice Krishna consciousness simply by beginning with chanting
Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare.
Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare.
Now, by chanting and associating with devotees
and hearing or reading these books in their respective languages,
people can actually awaken their dormant Krishna consciousness
which is already there in everyone's heart.
They can awaken their Krishna consciousness and actually start making progress
simply by beginning with chanting
and gradually becoming more interested in the spiritual subject matter
which is appealing to every human being,
especially every human being.
Actually, it is meant for all living beings,
all spirit souls in all forms of life.
But, the human form is special.
That every human being has already got
the brain substance to understand
the importance of spiritual life.
Every human being has got it.
Therefore, you can see the inquisitiveness
in a child which is born in any type of family,
any type of background, doesn't matter.
The inquisitiveness is indicated when the child begins to speak.
It begins asking all kinds of questions from the parents.
Any child which begins to talk,
any mother will testify to this.
All mothers will testify.
That when it begins to speak,
it keeps on asking questions, questions, questions.
What is this? What is that?
What is this? What is that?
Why this? Why that?
Now, which means that,
now this is true for a child born of poor parents,
rich parents,
Indian parents,
American parents,
educated parents,
uneducated parents.
It's true for all children.
That is why our scriptures say
human form is very, very precious.
That's why the scriptures say that.
So, that inquisitiveness,
Jigyasa,
should be directed towards Brahma Jigyasa.
Athato Brahma Jigyasa.
That's the duty of the parents.
And the parents are actually
meant to direct the child to the Acharya,
to the bona fide spiritual master.
And Acharyas preach to everyone
how to begin spiritual life
by chanting Hare Krishna
and how to progress
by simple, very, very simple practices.
Offering food and eat,
partaking the remnants of Prasadam.
Everybody eats.
But then don't simply eat like animals.
You take Prasadam
and spiritualize your entire
existence.
Ahara Shuddhau
Sattva Sattva Shuddhihi
This is explained in the Bhagavad Gita by Srila Prabhupada.
Ahara Shuddhau Sattva Shuddhihi
You take purified foodstuff,
your existence itself,
Sattva existence becomes purified.
The entire body becomes purified.
The mind becomes purified.
The intelligence becomes purified.
So it's so important
that people be taught
to chant Hare Krishna
and offer the food they are eating to Krishna
and then partake the remnants of such
food offered to Krishna.
Prasadam. Krishna Prasadam.
This is possible for every human being
irrespective of who they are,
what their social status is
or what their economic condition is.
It's possible for everybody.
Because everybody is eating something
for their survival.
So it's possible for everybody.
They have to be properly directed,
guided.
Guidance is required.
Now in taking guidance,
there is no discrimination to be made.
Even the most intellectually developed person
also requires his guidance.
And of course,
those who are not so intelligent
or those who are not so intellectually developed,
they also require guidance.
Everyone requires guidance.
That direction is given by the Acharya.
So simply by this,
it's possible for everyone to become Krishna conscious
and prepare themselves to go back home,
back to God.
I'll stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
